image.altText: Geelong mum Sheridan Digby standing outside in sunlight, looking off to the side with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: Sheridan Digby had hoped a 2019 remedial massage would help fix her sore neck. Instead, she says it caused her to suffer a stroke. The Geelong mum is now suing the masseuse and medical clinic, arguing they are liable for her injuries.

title.children: Sheridan suffered a stroke after a massage. Now she's suing the masseuse for negligence

image.altText: Sabrina James and Marjorie Johnston share a laugh

props.synopsis: In the midst of a housing crisis, roughly 12 million bedrooms sit empty. But housemates Marjorie Johnston and Sabrina James reckon they have hit on a solution.

title.children: Meet the odd-couple housemates who are 72 years apart

image.altText: Clare Looker appears serious, standing in front of an artwork at a press conference.

props.synopsis: An outbreak of Legionnaires' disease in metropolitan Melbourne has continued to grow, as health authorities race to find the source of infection.

title.children: Melbourne Legionnaires' disease mystery outbreak swells to at least 33

image.altText: A man in sunglasses with tattoos

props.synopsis: A coroner has recommended that Victoria Police look at the viability of having body worn cameras in place for all Special Operations Group (SOG) officers, following an inquest into the death of northern Victoria man Stanley Turvey.Â

title.children: Coroner says elite police acted within the law when they shot dangerous fugitive Stanley Turvey

image.altText: Australia's Kaylee McKeown punches the air and yells in the pool after winning an Olympic title.

props.synopsis: Kaylee McKeown streams past American rival Regan Smith in the women's 100m backstroke final to claim gold and set a new Olympics record. Follow live.

title.children: McKeown wins gold and defends her 100m backstroke in stunning Paris Olympics swim

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Artistic gymnastics: It's gold for Biles and Team USA

image.altText: A concrete building is damaged and crumbling after an apparent air attack

props.synopsis: Israel's air force says its air strike targeted Muhsin Shukr, also known as Fuad Shukr, who it believes was responsible for ordering an attack on Golan Heights that left 12 people dead at the weekend.

title.children: IDF strikes Beirut in attack targeting senior Hezbollah commander

image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

props.synopsis: Rex Airlines, Australia's largest regional and domestic airline operator, enters administration with domestic 737 services grounded and Virgin Australia offering free rebooking.

title.children: Rex Airlines enters voluntary administration but regional routes continuing to operate

image.altText: A young woman holding a black and white photo of her mother.

props.synopsis: Romany Wake and Shakira Robertson used to be next door neighbours. Now they're trying to support each other after both their mothers were killed tragically in separate incidents.

title.children: 'I've just killed your mum': Romany Wake's father committed murder, then told her to call triple-0

image.altText: A middle-aged man with his arms crossed stands in front of rolling fields.

props.synopsis: A Victorian government scheme designed to fast-track renewable projects is leaving those wanting to appeal approvals with limited options for recourse.

title.children: Landowner all but powerless to fight the solar farm proposal threatening his slice of paradise

image.altText: A composite image of three young girls, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift pays tribute to the children killed and injured in a stabbing attack at a dance class being held to her music on Monday, saying she's "completely in shock", as the death toll from the incident rises.

title.children: Taylor Swift pays tribute to children killed in UK stabbing attack at dance class as death toll rises

image.altText: A doctor gives Hunter a spoonful of puree with peanut powder in it.

props.synopsis: Babies with a peanut allergy will be offered oral immunotherapy in Australia for the first time as part of a new standardised model of care in hospitals across the country.Â

title.children: Peanut allergies in babies to be treated for the first time under national model of care

image.altText: Australian basketballer Josh Giddey pushes past two Canada defenders during a men's Olympic basketball match

props.synopsis: Canada has reaffirmed its status as a favourite for a medal in Paris, handing Australia's Boomers their first loss in their second group game.

title.children: Boomers suffer first Olympic defeat after being outmuscled by Canada

image.altText: 7s emotion

props.synopsis: After arriving in Paris as co-favourites for the gold, Australia finishes fourth in the women's rugby sevens after shock losses to Canada and the United States.

title.children: 'They're devastated': Australia misses medals in rugby sevens after US score 85m try at the death

image.altText: Australian players celebrate with their arms in the air

props.synopsis: Australia's men's water polo team take down two-time defending Olympic champions Serbia, backing up their mantra to surprise the world.

title.children: The Aussie Sharks live up to their pledge to 'shock the world' in Paris

image.altText: Two men in rain jackets, walk with a woman who is carrying a child through the mud.

props.synopsis: Local authorities say rescue operations have been hampered after a main bridge collapsed in the region.

title.children: Landslides in India's Kerala state kill at least 108 and injure more than 120

image.altText: A man holding a red umbrella and two women walk past a black wall that reads Reserve Bank of Australia.

props.synopsis: The RBA will decide whether to hike or hold rates next Tuesday. The bank's new deputy governor has offered us some clues to which way they might go.

title.children: Will the Reserve Bank hike or hold rates next week? The new deputy governor has given us a few clues

image.altText: Constable Randall Kirk walking in front of two other men wearing a blazer with a police name badge pinned onto it and glasses.

props.synopsis: Footage from Constable Randall Kirk's body worn camera shows him hiding behind a tree and running to the police car to escape the property at Wieambilla.Â

title.children: Officer's body worn footage shows moment he ran as shots fired at Wieambilla

image.altText: Penny Wong stands behind a wooden lectern outside outside gesturing while speaking to people out of shot

props.synopsis: The Australian foreign minister made the comments after visiting the tense border village shared by North and South Korea.

title.children: 'Risky for the world': Penny Wong concerned by Russia and North Korea's defence deal

image.altText: An aurora visible on the horizon, over water.

props.synopsis: The stunning weather event that delighted stargazers around the world returns to Australian skies, with the geomagnetic storm expected to be at its strongest on Tuesday evening but lasting for several days.

title.children: Aurora australis lights up the sky as BOM forecasts significant geomagnetic activity

image.altText: A group of several islands surrounded by clear waters

props.synopsis: A woman suffers serious injuries in a shark attack while snorkelling off Rat Island, part of the Abrolhos Islands off the WA coast.Â

title.children: Woman suffers serious injuries in shark bite incident off WA coast

image.altText: Kamala Harris, in a beige suite, looks over her shoulders at the top of aircraft stairs

props.synopsis: North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper and Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer are both out of the race to become Kamala Harris's running mate.

title.children: Kamala Harris running mate race narrows, with two more candidates out

image.altText: A swimmer looks on during a training session

props.synopsis: Lani Pallister, who was regarded as a genuine chance of claiming a medal in the 1,500m freestyle, has withdrawn from the event after testing positive to COVID.Â

title.children: Lani Pallister withdraws from 1,500m freestyle after testing positive to COVID

image.altText: Four men and a woman pose in an aquatics centre.

props.synopsis: Bob Ballard says he is sorry if his comment on the Australian women swim team, which was criticised for being sexist, caused offence to some people.Â

title.children: Commentator responds after removal from Olympics over gendered comment on Australian swimmers

image.altText: A firefighter silhouetted against a wall of flame by the side of the road

props.synopsis: The fire sparked by the car is now the sixth largest wildfire in Californian history, across more than 149,000 hectares and only 12 per cent contained.Â

title.children: California is facing one of the biggest fires in its history. Investigators say one man is responsible

image.altText: A woman wearing  a hijab is shown from behind, she also wears a Palestinian scarf.

props.synopsis: As the Albanese government mulls over its special envoy to combat Islamophobia, the Muslim community questions the delay and what the role can achieve.

title.children: 'We don't believe in a hierarchy of racism': Why some Muslim leaders say an Islamophobia envoy isn't necessary

image.altText: Sinead O'Connor wearing a black suit, golden cross necklace, and priest's collar while holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: Shortly after the one-year anniversary of SinÃ©ad O'Connor's death at age 56, an Irish newspaper is reporting a death certificate reveals the singer died from chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and bronchial asthma.

title.children: More details about SinÃ©ad O'Connor's cause of death revealed

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis:
New data issued by the Australian Bureau of Statistics show the total number of dwellings approved in June fell by 6.5 per cent. Some experts are calling on Australia to adopt more alternative construction models.


Â

title.children: Construction body says Australia will struggle to build 1.2 million new homes if building approvals don't improve

image.altText: A woman runs past a police barricade with a fire lit in front

props.synopsis: Demonstrators are protesting outside the presidential palace and toppling down statues following the re-election of Venezuela's president NicolÃ¡s Maduro. Here's your breakdown.Â

title.children: 'We're fed up': Why deadly protests are erupting in Venezuela following the country's election

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today â and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings for day four of the Olympic Games

image.altText: Ryan Murphy hugs his wife in the stands. She holds a sign reading "Ryan It's A Girl"

props.synopsis: That's the surprise message that American swimmer Ryan Murphy got from the pool deck as he looked up at his wife in the stands at the Paris Olympics.

title.children: 'It's a girl!' Olympian discovers gender of unborn child while standing on Paris podium

image.altText: An aerial shot shows mourners from the Druze minority surrounding five white coffins.

props.synopsis: Israel promised to make Hezbollah pay for the strike in Majdal Shams, but as the war in Gaza drags on it finds itself in a tough position.

title.children: Israel thought two unusual security strategies kept it safe. Here's why they may no longer work

image.altText: A woman holds her arm to her forehead while laying on a bed.

props.synopsis: Australian women with menopause are leaving the workforce early over a lack of support, Australian unions tell a Senate inquiry into menopause and perimenopause. They're calling for 10 days paid leave to help keep them at work.Â

title.children: Australian unions call for 10 days paid reproductive leave to support women with menopause
